Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2015 10:31PM Mommy_of_3K wrote: MusicLover: thank you for replying! The surgeon's office called me today. That was fast! The referral was put in just yesterday. They have an opening next Wednesday. I didn't realise they could biopsy a lymph node! I guess it makes sense now that I think about it. I'm just worried because of family history and the weird symptoms I've had for months prior to finding the lump. If anything, I will be glad if they can figure out why I have been feeling so unwell!
Posts.Title: Can a cyst cause enlarged lymph node? Mommy_of_3K Mommy_of_3K

Posts.Content: Mommy_of_3K wrote: I am new to post but have been reading for weeks. I am 31 with a strong family history of BC. My first symptoms were a general feeling of unwell and extreme dizziness for several months. I have also had strep 3 times this year and pneumonia once. I am NEVER sick! I felt an ache or burn, sort of like a bee sting, in my right breast, which prompted a self exam. When I found a lump, I went to my GYN who ordered a 3d mammogram and ultrasound with biopsy as clinically necessary. My appointment for this is 945 EST tomorrow. What should I expect? I'm SO scared! ! What does biopsy as clinically necessary even mean?! Any advice is greatly appreciated!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: FIRST TIME ! 3d mammogram and ultrasound tomorrow morning... Mommy_of_3K Mommy_of_3K

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2015 10:50AM Mommy_of_3K wrote: Thank you italychick and lipglossmommie for replying! Your responses are helpful. I know I shouldn't be worrying until I am actually given something to worry about! And hopefully I won't be. I sit here waiting for the dr to call with the MRI results.
Posts.Title: Is it normal for lymph nodes to light up on MRI? Mommy_of_3K Mommy_of_3K

Posts.Content: Mommy_of_3K wrote: I have had a 3d diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound for a palpable lump in my right breast . Nothing was shown so they sent me for a breast MRI. The lump STILL didn't show. However, my left breast shows an oval shaped clumped enhancement with plateau kinetics. This now has them concerned and I am scheduled for biopsy. This newly found mass seems to have taken precedent over the palpable lump in the other breast. Should I ask for an excisional biopsy to be done when they biopsy the mass on the other breast or should I wait to see what pathology shows? I just don't like the idea of a lump that suddenly appeared and isn't showing on imaging!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump not showing on mammagram, ultrasound, OR MRI!! Mommy_of_3K MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Mommy_of_3K wrote: I had a 3d diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound because of a lump I found. The report says it's probably a cyst. It also says I have an enlarged lymph node under my arm on the same side. My question is, would a simple cyst cause lymph nodes to swell? They are giving me a referral to a breast surgeon because I wasn't satisfied with "its probably a cyst". I have a strong family history of breast cancer and something is telling me not to let this go. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Can a cyst cause enlarged lymph node? Mommy_of_3K Mommy_of_3K

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2015 12:02PM Mommy_of_3K wrote: No news yet! I called Radiology a couple hours ago and she said that it normally takes 48 hours (which it has been) but they needed to consult with another Radiologist that specializes in only breasts at another center. I'm sort of confused. I was in a breast only MRI section of the hospital. Anyway, nothing yet!
Posts.Title: Is it normal for lymph nodes to light up on MRI? Mommy_of_3K Mommy_of_3K

Posts.Content: Mommy_of_3K wrote: long story short: felt a lump, GYN sent me for 3d diagnostic mammo and US. Lump didn't show on either but "enlarged, prominent" lymph node did. Referred to breast surgeon who ordered breast MRI. Today I had the MRI and briefly saw some of the images. The only thing I recognized were the location of lymph nodes. I'm wondering if it is normal for lymph nodes to appear on MRI or do they only light up if cancerous? The tech, after showing me these images, touched my shoulder and said "good luck" as she walked me out. That in itself makes me nervous waiting ! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is it normal for lymph nodes to light up on MRI? Mommy_of_3K Mommy_of_3K

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2015 04:35PM Mommy_of_3K wrote: Finally heard from the surgeon today about my MRI results. There is a suspicious abnormality present. I am now being sent for an ultrasound guided biopsy. If it's not seen on ultrasound then they will do an MRI guided biopsy. I've already had an ultrasound and nothing showed so I'm frustrated that I even have to attempt it!
